instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BLK_EN: What is BLK_EN? This is a typo of BKL_EN When you see BLK_EN, assume they meant to type BKL_EN.
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message: Ok, So I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has no backlight. Image it confirmed with flashlight. F9700 is not blown. I checked <SIGNAL>BLK_EN</SIGNAL> and it is at 2.8V. Could use a little guidance on where to check next.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message:
Any history available?
Post exact voltage at pin 1 of J9000 and pin 2 of <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>.

Did you try known good compatible LCD assembly?
Also do few times PRAM reset.
Post diode mode to ground on both pins of <DIODE>D9701</DIODE>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message: Ok, So I discovered the LCD cable was damaged so I replaced it. No change. went to measure F9700 and it was popped. Replaced that and we now have back light restored. Now I gotta tackle the issue of not seeing the keyboard or trackpad. Any Ideas on that? BTW a little history on this machine. No reports of liquid damage though I am sure it has been dropped once or more, the back corner of the machine is ever so slightly bent. board looks really clean though I have not removed it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message:
KB/TP not working before and once entered OSX too?
I recommend to try known good TP flex as first stept; is the most common failure.
Next step, try good TP board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message: ok, thanks! I will try that. as far as I know, the T-Pad and KB were not working before and once I get into OSX. But the "power" button works.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message:
Power button "remains" on the MLB.
The rest of keys go to PCH through trackpad cicuitry.
